title: Antigravity IDE vs Cursor v2 2025: Which AI Code Editor Wins?
metaDescription: Detailed 2025 comparison of Antigravity IDE's revolutionary multi-agent AI vs Cursor v2's codebase intelligence. Discover pricing, features, and which tool is best for your projects.
introduction:
The landscape of AI-powered development tools has been dramatically reshaped in late 2025 with two standout contenders: Antigravity IDE and Cursor v2. While both promise to revolutionize how developers write, edit, and debug code, they approach the problem from fundamentally different angles. Antigravity has stormed onto the scene with its unique multi-agent orchestration system, claiming the #1 spot in developer rankings by enabling AI agents to collaborate on complex tasks autonomously. Meanwhile, Cursor v2 has solidified its position as a massively popular choice by deepening its codebase intelligence and refining its already powerful editing workflows.

This comparison dives deep into the capabilities, philosophies, and practical applications of these two cutting-edge platforms. As developers face increasingly complex projects and tighter deadlines, choosing the right AI assistant has become a critical decision that can impact productivity, code quality, and even project architecture. Whether you're building simple applications or enterprise-scale systems, understanding the strengths and limitations of Antigravity's collaborative AI agents versus Cursor's deeply integrated code understanding is essential for making an informed choice in today's competitive development environment.

sections.title: Overview
paragraphs: Antigravity IDE represents a paradigm shift in AI-assisted development with its revolutionary multi-agent architecture. Unlike traditional single-model AI tools, Antigravity orchestrates multiple specialized AI agents that collaborate on coding tasks, enabling it to tackle complex projects that would overwhelm conventional systems. Built on VS Code foundations but enhanced with unique capabilities like integrated Chrome browser automation and 3D graphics support, Antigravity debuted at #1 in December 2025 developer rankings and remains completely free during its preview period, making it accessible to developers of all levels.

Cursor v2 has evolved from its earlier iterations into a mature, massively popular AI code editor that excels at understanding entire codebases. The late 2025 update brings state-of-the-art local and cloud model integration, offering unprecedented code generation, editing, and debugging capabilities. As a freemium tool with seamless VSCode migration, Cursor v2 focuses on deep codebase awareness and intelligent editing workflows, making it particularly valuable for developers working on large, existing projects where context is everything.

sections.title: Pricing Comparison
paragraphs: The pricing models between these two platforms represent fundamentally different approaches. Antigravity IDE is completely free during its preview period, with no announced pricing tiers or limitations on its most advanced features like multi-agent orchestration and browser automation. This makes it exceptionally accessible for individual developers, students, and teams experimenting with AI-assisted development. Cursor v2 follows a freemium model with clear tiered pricing: a free tier with basic AI capabilities, a Pro tier ($20/month) offering unlimited AI usage and advanced features, and a Business tier ($40/user/month) with team management and security features. While Cursor's free tier is generous, accessing its full potential requires subscription, whereas Antigravity currently offers its complete feature set at no cost.

sections.title: Features & Capabilities
paragraphs: Antigravity's standout feature is its multi-agent orchestration—a capability no competitor offers—where multiple AI agents collaborate autonomously on complex coding tasks. This is complemented by integrated Chrome browser automation for testing, live preview with design-to-code conversion, and support for cutting-edge models including Gemini 3 Pro and Claude 4.5. The platform also features 3D graphics support, Git integration, collaborative editing, and voice interaction via its Wave 11 update. Cursor v2 excels with its full codebase awareness and chat, Composer mode for complex edits, integrated terminal with AI capabilities, and multi-model support including local models. While Cursor offers excellent code understanding and editing workflows, it lacks Antigravity's multi-agent collaboration and browser automation features.

sections.title: Use Cases
paragraphs: Antigravity IDE shines for complex, multi-faceted projects requiring autonomous AI collaboration. Its multi-agent system makes it ideal for full-stack development, web applications needing browser automation testing, 3D graphics projects, and situations where different AI specializations (frontend, backend, testing) need to work together. The free pricing makes it perfect for startups, indie developers, and educational purposes. Cursor v2 is best suited for developers working on large, existing codebases where deep understanding of project architecture is crucial. Its codebase intelligence excels at refactoring, debugging complex systems, and maintaining legacy code. The freemium model with local model support makes it valuable for enterprise environments with privacy concerns and teams needing reliable, predictable AI assistance.

sections.title: Pros & Cons
paragraphs: Antigravity Pros: Revolutionary multi-agent collaboration (unique in market), completely free during preview, integrated browser automation for testing, supports latest AI models (Gemini 3 Pro, Claude 4.5), 3D graphics support, voice interaction. Antigravity Cons: Newer platform with less established track record, future pricing uncertain after preview, may have steeper learning curve due to multi-agent concepts, potentially less stable than mature alternatives.

Cursor v2 Pros: Excellent codebase understanding and intelligence, mature platform with large user base, seamless VSCode migration, local model support for privacy, reliable editing workflows, established freemium pricing model. Cursor v2 Cons: Lacks multi-agent collaboration capabilities, browser automation not integrated, requires subscription for full features, less innovative in AI architecture compared to Antigravity.

verdict:
Choosing between Antigravity IDE and Cursor v2 ultimately depends on your development priorities, project complexity, and willingness to embrace cutting-edge versus established technology. For developers seeking the absolute frontier of AI-assisted coding and working on complex, multi-component projects, Antigravity IDE represents the clear choice. Its revolutionary multi-agent orchestration system is genuinely unique in the market, enabling autonomous collaboration between specialized AI agents that can tackle problems no single-model system can handle. The integrated Chrome browser automation, 3D graphics support, and completely free pricing during preview make it an irresistible option for innovative projects and developers comfortable with newer technology.

However, for developers working primarily within large, existing codebases where deep understanding and reliable editing workflows are paramount, Cursor v2 remains the safer, more established choice. Its codebase intelligence is exceptional, the platform is mature with excellent community support, and the freemium model provides clear upgrade paths for teams. The ability to use local models addresses privacy concerns that Antigravity's cloud-based approach may not satisfy for enterprise environments.

Our recommendation: If you're building complex new systems, experimenting with AI collaboration, or working on projects requiring browser automation or 3D graphics, choose Antigravity IDE and take advantage of its free preview period. If you're maintaining or refactoring large existing codebases, need reliable enterprise-ready tools, or prioritize privacy with local models, choose Cursor v2. Both represent excellent choices in the 2025 AI development landscape, but they serve different masters—Antigravity serves innovation and complexity, while Cursor serves reliability and deep understanding.

faqs.question: Is Antigravity IDE really completely free?
faqs.answer: Yes, during its preview period, Antigravity IDE is completely free with no limitations on its most advanced features including multi-agent orchestration, browser automation, and support for premium AI models like Gemini 3 Pro and Claude 4.5. The platform debuted at #1 in December 2025 rankings while remaining free, though future pricing after the preview period has not been announced. This makes it an exceptional value for developers wanting to experiment with cutting-edge AI collaboration without financial commitment.

faqs.question: Can Cursor v2 handle complex multi-file projects as well as Antigravity?
faqs.answer: Cursor v2 excels at understanding and working with complex multi-file projects through its full codebase awareness feature. It can analyze relationships between files, understand project architecture, and make intelligent edits across multiple components. However, it approaches this differently than Antigravity—Cursor uses a single, highly intelligent AI model with deep context understanding, while Antigravity uses multiple specialized agents that collaborate. For traditional codebase navigation and editing, Cursor is excellent, but for autonomous multi-agent collaboration on complex tasks, Antigravity's approach is unique and potentially more powerful for certain types of projects.
